r.s: Provides an api to create a HTML tree
r.d: PHP Based api creates a tree structure using a couple of small PHP classes. This can then be converted to javascript using the printMenu() method. The tree is dynamic in IE 4 or higher and NN6/Mozilla, and maintains state (the collapsed/expanded status of the branches) by using cookies. Other browsers display the tree fully expanded. Each node can have an optional link and icon. New API in 1.1 with many changes (see CVS for changelog) and new features, of which most came from Chip Chapin (http://www.chipchapin.com).
r.n: Added expanded icon support. Added documentation in Word and PDF formats. Moved structure import code to its own static method createFromStructure(), and added support for my own Tree class (http://phpguru.org/tree.html) as well as Wolfram Kriesings Tree class.
